description: A recipe for classic crab dip made with cream cheese and cheddar cheese and baked in the oven.
headline: Cheesy Hot Crab Dip

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The dip can be assembled, unbaked, up to a day ahead of time. Tightly cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and refrigerate. Let it sit at room temperature while the oven heats to take the chill off, then bake uncovered as directed. Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 2 days.

name: Cheesy Hot Crab Dip
recipeIngredient: 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
4 ounces sharp cheddar cheese, shredded (about 1 cup)
For serving: toasted bread, crackers, and/or vegetable crudités

recipeInstructions.text: Take 8 ounces cream cheese out of the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature and soften on the counter if needed, about 20 minutes.

Arrange a rack in the top third of the oven (about 6 inches from the broiling element) and heat the oven to 350°F. Lightly coat an 8x8-inch or other 2-quart broiler-safe baking dish or skillet with olive oil or cooking spray.

Shred 4 ounces sharp cheddar cheese (about 1 cup) and place in a large bowl. Thinly slice the white and green parts of 2 medium scallions (about 1/4 cup) and add to the white and light green slices to the bowl, reserving the dark green slices for garnish. Add the softened cream cheese, 1/3 cup sour cream, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon hot sauce, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Use a wooden spoon to mix well.
Add 1 pound lump crabmeat and fold to just combine. Transfer the mixture to the prepared dish and spread out in an even layer.

Bake until hot and bubbling, about 25 minutes. Switch the broiler on and broil until top is golden-brown, 3 to 5 minutes more. Let cool 10 minutes. Garnish with reserved sliced dark green scallions and serve hot or warm with toasted bread, crackers, and/or crudite.

video.description: What's the easiest way to win at parties? Make a hot dip. A cold dip is all well and good, but a warm, bubbling, extra-gooey dip will always get the crowd cheering. This hot crab dip is a little bit retro in the best way possible. Packed with two kinds of cheese and a gentle kick from a few shakes of hot sauce, it's one of the very best things you can snack on this time of year.
video.name: Hot Crab Dip
